Localisation.report_string:
--- Localisation ---
Agree with lesion involving:
- left midbrain.

Differential diagnosis.report_string:
--- Differential diagnosis ---
Correctly included: Multiple sclerosis
  
These suggested differentials are reasonable:

- Ischaemic midbrain stroke (paramedian PCA perforator infarct); Midbrain cavernous malformation with recent haemorrhage; Intrinsic brainstem glioma; Neurosarcoidosis involving the midbrain; Brainstem abscess

ft_diagnoses_raw: Multiple sclerosis presenting with a left midbrain plaque
Ischaemic midbrain stroke (paramedian PCA perforator infarct)
Midbrain cavernous malformation with recent haemorrhage
additional_diagnoses: Ischaemic midbrain stroke (paramedian PCA perforator infarct)
Midbrain cavernous malformation with recent haemorrhage

Investigations.report_string:
--- Investigations ---
Agree with all suggestions.

- MRI including the Brain and CSF test for Oligoclonal Bands would potentially inform a diagnosis of multiple sclerosis.

ft_proposed_investigations: MRI brain with and without gadolinium including DWI and SWI
MR angiogram of head and neck (or CT angiogram)
CSF oligoclonal bands and IgG index
CSF bacterial culture and viral PCR

Management.report_string:
--- Management ---
Steroids: Inappropriate decision to suggest treatment.
  
Additional factors not mentioned:

- Symptoms started more than 14 days ago.

- Presenting complaint is not specified, so no indication whether this is related to MS.

DMTs: Appropriate decision to consider but delay treatment.
  
Correctly identified the following:

- Need confirmation of MS diagnosis.

ft_full_plan_parsed.treatment: Intermittent pneumatic compression for DVT prophylaxis
reasons: Right hemiparesis with reduced mobility
Safe irrespective of final diagnosis
Improve gait instability and hemiparesis
Prevents deconditioning
Right-sided spasticity causing impairment
Improves comfort and function

ft_full_plan_parsed.treatment: Eye care for diplopia/ptosis (lubricants, occlusive patch/prism as needed)
reasons: Left oculomotor palsy with exposure/diplopia risk
Prevents corneal injury and improves symptoms

ft_full_plan_parsed.treatment: Aspirin 300 mg load then 75–100 mg daily
reasons: Start only if MRI confirms ischaemic infarct
Avoids worsening if cavernoma haemorrhage or tumour
Indicated for confirmed ischaemic stroke for secondary prevention
Not required for demyelinating or haemorrhagic causes
Only if cardioembolic source identified
Contraindicated in haemorrhagic/cavernoma aetiology

ft_full_plan_parsed.treatment: Intravenous methylprednisolone 1 g daily for 3–5 days
reasons: Initiate if MRI/CSF support an acute demyelinating relapse
Exclude active infection before steroids
Consider for cavernous malformation with symptomatic bleed or intrinsic tumor
Management depends on imaging and clinical course

ft_full_plan_parsed.treatment: Long-term disease-modifying therapy for multiple sclerosis (if confirmed)
reasons: Requires diagnostic confirmation and risk–benefit counselling
Choice guided by MRI lesion load and prognostic factors

ft_plan.treatment: Intravenous methylprednisolone 1 g daily for 3–5 days
reasons: Initiate if MRI/CSF support an acute demyelinating relapse
Exclude active infection before steroids

missing_information: Presenting complaint is not specified, so no indication whether this is related to MS.
contraindications: Symptoms started more than 14 days ago.
